title: Blockchain Mobility Media – Indonesia
summary: Cardano’s real utility is absent in Indonesian media. Used-car buyers face trust issues daily, yet no local content explains Cardano and CAR-dano v1 solve them through RWA and transparent governance
solution: Producing structured e-learning modules, and infographics in Bahasa Indonesia and Javanese, using real automotive workflows to explain blockchain utility and Cardano governance in a relatable way.
proposer_name: PT Inspeksi Mobil Jogja (PALAPA Inspeksi)/ CAR-dano v1

sub_fields.title: Category Questions
sub_fields.description: Answer the following questions to determine the eligibility of your proposal.

sub_fields.title: Who you’re targeting, how you’ll reach them, and why this matters for Cardano?
sub_fields.description: Please provide your rationale.
sub_fields.answer:
**Who you’re targeting**

1. Indonesian-speaking Web3-curious users
2. Used-car buyers, small dealers, mechanics, inspectors
3. Students (engineering, information systems, business)
4. Cardano community + broader multi-chain Web3 groups in Indonesia



**How you’ll reach them**

1. YouTube structured playlists (12-episode core series)
2. TikTok/Instagram short-form explainers
3. Infographics for Telegram/X community sharing
4. Local-language storytelling (Bahasa Indonesia + selected Javanese segments)
5. Campus/community watch-parties using the published modules



**Why this matters for Cardano**

Indonesia is a strategic Web3 hub. Cardano has strong technical advantages but weak narrative penetration. By tying Cardano to used-car trust (a mainstream problem) and governance (a unique Cardano feature), the ecosystem gains visibility, relevance, and a differentiated position

sub_fields.title: Provide a list of key activities of your project:
sub_fields.description: Please provide your rationale.
sub_fields.answer:
**1\. Video Education Series \(12 episodes\)**

Topics include:

- Blockchain for Used Cars
- On-chain inspection reports (with CAR-dano v1 examples)
- Cardano Governance for Everyone
- “From Inspection Bay to Blockchain” narrative episode
- Short myth-busting and FAQ videos



**2\. Infographics & Social Media Packs \(20–24 assets\)**

Visual explanations on:

- Automotive trust workflows
- Simple governance diagrams
- How inspection data becomes metadata
- RWA storytelling adapted for Indonesian audiences



**3\. E\-learning Mini Modules \(2–3 units\)**

- Module A – Blockchain for Used Cars
- Module B – Cardano Governance for Non-Developers
- Module C – Optional intro to metadata anchoring



All modules include assessment questions and open-access files.

sub_fields.title: What are your success metrics?
sub_fields.description: Please provide your rationale.
sub_fields.answer:
**Content KPIs**

- ≥10 long-form videos (public, open-licensed)
- ≥20 infographics / visual packs
- ≥2 complete e-learning modules



**Engagement KPIs**

- ≥5,000 cumulative video views
- ≥1,500 interactions across social platforms
- ≥100 learners completing a module



**Community Impact**

- ≥3 community/campus sessions using the content
- 30+ feedback responses confirming improved understanding



**Ecosystem Reusability**

- ≥3 Cardano/Web3 groups reuse or translate content
- ≥1 DRep/education project integrates assets into their work

sub_fields.title: Please describe your proposed solution and how it addresses the problem
sub_fields.description: Please describe your proposed solution and how it addresses the problem
sub_fields.answer:
Most Indonesian users only encounter blockchain as speculation. This project shifts the narrative by grounding Cardano in concrete scenarios used-car inspections, fraud prevention, and transparent records areas where CAR-dano v1 already demonstrated viability.



The initiative creates a cohesive educational ecosystem: videos, infographics, and modules designed for replay, reuse, and translation. Content is localized, avoids technical jargon, and uses automotive metaphors familiar to Indonesian audiences. Governance topics (DReps, CIP-1694, treasury) are explained visually and accessibly, reducing the barrier to participation.



Rather than one-off talks, the media library becomes a durable public good for Indonesia and ASEAN, elevating Cardano’s presence in a strategic market and supporting future RWA and governance proposals.

sub_fields.title: Please define the positive impact your project will have on the wider Cardano community
sub_fields.description: Please define the positive impact your project will have on the wider Cardano community
sub_fields.answer:
This project strengthens Cardano’s position in one of the world’s most active crypto markets by giving users clear, familiar stories about real utility automotive trust, inspection data, and governance.



**Key impacts:**

1. Increased visibility: Cardano becomes associated with solving real Indonesian problems, not just trading.
2. Ready-to-use resources: DReps, educators, and builders gain plug-and-play assets for outreach.
3. Builder pipeline: Local teams proposing RWA/governance work can rely on this media for user onboarding.
4. Cross-industry potential: The automotive narrative can inspire similar content for logistics, insurance, and heavy equipment.
5. Long-term community health: Users gain a clearer understanding of governance mechanisms and real-world asset reasoning.

sub_fields.title: What is your capability to deliver your project with high levels of trust and accountability? How do you intend to validate if your approach is feasible?
sub_fields.description: What is your capability to deliver your project with high levels of trust and accountability? How do you intend to validate if your approach is feasible?
sub_fields.answer:
# Why This Team Can Deliver


**Real\-world domain expertise**

PT Inspeksi Mobil Jogja (PALAPA) conducts hundreds of inspections monthly across multiple cities and delivered CAR-dano v1 under Fund13. This ensures all automotive explanations are grounded in real operations.



**Educational & content experience**

The proposer has an engineering background, experience explaining technical concepts to non-technical audiences, and active involvement in Cardano RWA and governance discussions.



**Feasibility**

1. The scope (12 videos, 20–24 infographics, 2–3 modules) is realistic for 6 months.
2. Uses existing platforms (YouTube, TikTok, LMS tools).
3. Low operational risk and minimal dependency footprint.



**Validation**

1. Community/campus feedback
2. Engagement metrics
3. Early pilot releases
4. Iterative refinement of visuals and narratives

sub_fields.title: Project Milestones
sub_fields.description: What are the key milestones you need to achieve in order to complete your project successfully?

sub_fields.title: What are the key milestones you need to achieve in order to complete your project successfully?
sub_fields.description: The number of milestones required depends on the amount of funding requested. Please refer to the Guidance card on the right for details

sub_fields.title: Milestone Title
sub_fields.description: A clear, concise title for this milestone
sub_fields.answer: Content Blueprint & Pre-production

sub_fields.title: Milestone Outputs
sub_fields.description: What will be delivered in this milestone
sub_fields.answer:
The first milestone builds the intellectual backbone of the entire project. This includes creating a full and structured content map covering every planned asset: all video episodes, infographic topics, narrative arcs, key governance explainers, and the structure of each e-learning module. Each item will be mapped with objectives, audience focus, required visuals, and metadata.

The team will draft detailed scripts for the initial batch of videos, including analogies, visual cues, and Indonesian/Javanese linguistic adaptation. Early visual wireframes will also be produced for the first set of social media content these wireframes define layout, typography, iconography, and storytelling rhythm.

In parallel, a language and tone framework is created to ensure consistent delivery across all formats. This includes vocabulary style guides, glossary of key terms, translation patterns, and narrative strategies for explaining automotive and governance concepts.

Finally, a complete production schedule and release workflow is established, covering recording, editing, subtitling, graphic handoff, and publishing cadence.

sub_fields.title: Acceptance Criteria
sub_fields.description: Specific conditions that must be met
sub_fields.answer:
A clearly structured, publicly accessible content blueprint must be published via Google Docs/Figma for transparency and review. At least four full-length video scripts must be complete and ready for recording. 



Five infographic drafts either in sketch or low-fidelity design form need to be available and approved internally. The full publishing calendar (video order, social posting frequency, module timelines) must be reviewed and greenlit.

sub_fields.title: Evidence of Completion
sub_fields.description: How you will demonstrate achievement
sub_fields.answer: Links to the content plan, script drafts, tone framework, wireframes, and production calendar will be provided. Screenshots of document timestamps, collaborative comments, and Figma file previews will serve as verification.

sub_fields.title: Delivery Month
sub_fields.description: The month when this milestone will be delivered

sub_fields.title: Cost
sub_fields.description: The cost of this milestone in ADA

sub_fields.title: Progress
sub_fields.description: Current status of the milestone

sub_fields.title: Milestone Title
sub_fields.description: A clear, concise title for this milestone
sub_fields.answer: First Content Batch & Soft Launch

sub_fields.title: Milestone Outputs
sub_fields.description: What will be delivered in this milestone
sub_fields.answer:
During this milestone, the first tangible content is released to the public. A minimum of five educational videos will be produced, edited, subtitled, and uploaded to YouTube with short-form derivatives tailored for TikTok/Instagram Reels. These videos will introduce core RWA concepts, used-car trust issues, and Cardano governance basics packaged in simple, narrative-driven Indonesian, with optional Javanese flavor for cultural grounding.



At least eight infographics will be designed and published across Instagram, X, and Telegram groups. These visuals will translate complex ideas (e.g., metadata flow, trust gaps, governance hierarchy) into digestible, shareable formats.

A dedicated visual identity system thumbnails, color palette, typography, and playlist organization will be established to ensure brand consistency across all platforms.



The first e-learning module (draft version) will be assembled using published video material, integrated readings, and beginner-level quiz questions for comprehension testing.

sub_fields.title: Acceptance Criteria
sub_fields.description: Specific conditions that must be met
sub_fields.answer: Five videos must be live publicly under open licenses (CC BY). Eight infographics must be both published and stored in an accessible open folder for reuse. The content must reach at least 500 combined views, signaling initial traction. The first module must be available in draft form for internal testing and peer review.

sub_fields.title: Evidence of Completion
sub_fields.description: How you will demonstrate achievement
sub_fields.answer: Links to all published videos, short clips, infographic posts, and open-access folders will be provided. Screenshots showing early engagement statistics, comments, and audience reach will validate performance. A link to the draft module file will also be included.

sub_fields.title: Delivery Month
sub_fields.description: The month when this milestone will be delivered

sub_fields.title: Cost
sub_fields.description: The cost of this milestone in ADA

sub_fields.title: Progress
sub_fields.description: Current status of the milestone

sub_fields.title: Milestone Title
sub_fields.description: A clear, concise title for this milestone
sub_fields.answer: Full Content Rollout & E-learning Modules

sub_fields.title: Milestone Outputs
sub_fields.description: What will be delivered in this milestone
sub_fields.answer:
This is the major production milestone. The team will finalize and release the complete media package:

1. at least ten full educational videos with structured playlists,
2. twenty infographics designed for multi-platform distribution, and
3. two complete e-learning modules containing learning objectives, readings, embedded videos, quizzes, and completion tracking.



The project will also begin real-world usage. At least two community or campus sessions online or offline will utilize the content. These sessions will involve guided viewing, Q&A, and short reflection segments to test comprehension and gather real user perspectives.



Systematic feedback will be collected through forms, comments, and informal interviews. These insights will be used to refine later content and shape the final playbook.

sub_fields.title: Acceptance Criteria
sub_fields.description: Specific conditions that must be met
sub_fields.answer: All planned content must be fully published, indexed, and consolidated into a simple landing hub (website, Notion page, or pinned post). Total video views must exceed 3,000, and interactions (likes, comments, shares, saves) must exceed 1,000 across channels. At least 50 learners must complete one e-learning module, verified through quiz submissions or form-based certification.

sub_fields.title: Evidence of Completion
sub_fields.description: How you will demonstrate achievement
sub_fields.answer: A final “content hub” link containing the centralized index of all assets will be provided. Screenshots from YouTube, TikTok, Instagram analytics will verify engagement numbers. Documentation from campus/community sessions (attendance screenshots, feedback summaries) will be included.

sub_fields.title: Delivery Month
sub_fields.description: The month when this milestone will be delivered

sub_fields.title: Cost
sub_fields.description: The cost of this milestone in ADA

sub_fields.title: Progress
sub_fields.description: Current status of the milestone

sub_fields.title: Milestone Title
sub_fields.description: A clear, concise title for this milestone
sub_fields.answer: Consolidation, Analytics & Playbook

sub_fields.title: Milestone Outputs
sub_fields.description: What will be delivered in this milestone
sub_fields.answer:
The final milestone consolidates the entire initiative into long-term ecosystem value. A comprehensive “Media Playbook” will be produced, documenting which topics performed best, how Indonesian/Javanese audience segments responded, which visual formats were most effective, and practical steps for other communities aiming to replicate the model in their own regions.



The team will host one or two public sharing sessions (Catalyst Town Hall segment, Cardano Indonesia session, or open webinar) to present results, lessons learned, and recommendations for future RWA/governance education projects.



A complete final report will be prepared, containing engagement analytics, module completion data, qualitative insights, and a financial summary.

sub_fields.title: Acceptance Criteria
sub_fields.description: Specific conditions that must be met
sub_fields.answer: The playbook must be openly published (PDF + public folder). At least one session must be recorded or summarized and shared with the ecosystem. The final project report must meet Catalyst’s milestone and close-out standards.

sub_fields.title: Evidence of Completion
sub_fields.description: How you will demonstrate achievement
sub_fields.answer: Links to the playbook, video recordings or written summaries of public sessions, and complete final reporting documents will be provided.

sub_fields.title: Please provide a cost breakdown of the proposed work and resources
sub_fields.description: Please provide a cost breakdown of the proposed work and resources
sub_fields.answer:
Total: 15,000 ADA

- Research & scripting – 4,000 ADA
- Video production – 5,000 ADA
- Design & e-learning – 3,000 ADA
- Distribution & reporting – 3,000 ADA

Budget mirrors efficient allocations from Fund14 winners: high output, low overhead, strong reusability.

sub_fields.title: How does the cost of the project represent value for the Cardano ecosystem?
sub_fields.description: How does the cost of the project represent value for the Cardano ecosystem?
sub_fields.answer:
With only 15,000 ADA, the project delivers a full local-language education suite videos, infographics, modules addressing automotive RWA and Cardano governance, two of Cardano’s strongest narratives.



The outputs are durable public goods, reusable by students, builders, DReps, and community leads across Indonesia and ASEAN. Content remains relevant for years and significantly elevates Cardano’s visibility in a high-potential emerging market.



This is a high-leverage, low-risk investment with ecosystem-wide benefits.
